verses.roman:
ācārya-gosāñira bhāṇḍāra--akṣaya, avyaya
yata dravya vyaya kare tata dravya haya

synonyms: ācārya-gosāñira—of Advaita Ācārya; bhāṇḍāra—storehouse; akṣaya—inexhaustible; avyaya—indestructible; yata—all; dravya—commodities; vyaya—expenditure; kare—does; tata—so much; dravya—commodity; haya—becomes filled.
translation: The supplies of Advaita Ācārya were inexhaustible and indestructible. As many goods and commodities as He used, just as many again appeared.
